newsitem.title: FRANCE: France distances itself from aide's U.N. swipe.
newsitem.headline: France distances itself from aide's U.N. swipe.

text.p: France sought to avert a row with the United States on Tuesday by distancing itself from a comment by a French diplomat that it would not be a tragedy if the United Nations moved out of New York.

The legal adviser of France's U.N. mission, Hubert Legal, made the remark to a U.N. committee on Monday in a discussion of new New York City rules under which diplomats are no longer exempt from paying parking fines.

"Were the United States to feel that it is impossible under current conditions to play host to diplomatic functions under appropriate conditions, well then I would put it this way -- it would not be a tragedy, there are other possibilities," he said.
Legal said the organisation could be transferred to Geneva, Vienna or elsewhere.
A foreign ministry spokesman in Paris disowned the comments.
